risks.divergence_summary: The internal policy's change request process is significantly less comprehensive than the new regulation's mandatory change management requirements, lacking specific timelines for approval, a requirement for an Independent Technical Review Board, client notification standards, and explicit documentation retention periods.
risks.conflicting_policy_excerpt:
3. Change Request Process
Any proposed change must be submitted via a Change Request Form with: description, rationale, affected systems, rollback plan, risk assessment.
risks.new_rule_excerpt:
2.1 Mandatory Change Approval Timelines
All infrastructure changes must receive written approval at least 72 hours before implementation. Emergency changes are permitted only for system outages affecting more than 50% of users or active security breaches.

2.2 Independent Review Board
Organizations with more than 10 employees must establish an Independent Technical Review Board consisting of at least three members who are not directly involved in day-to-day operations. This board must review and approve all high-risk changes before implementation.

2.3 Client Notification Standards
Clients must be notified at least 96 hours in advance of any planned maintenance or changes that may affect service availability, regardless of expected downtime duration.

2.4 Change Documentation Retention
All change logs, including rollback procedures and risk assessments, must be retained for a minimum of 7 years and made available to regulatory authorities within 48 hours of request.
risks.recommendation: The legal team must initiate an immediate revision of the company's 'Change Request Process' policy to fully incorporate all mandatory requirements specified in Article 2 (Change Management Requirements) of Law No. 09-2025, particularly regarding approval timelines, the establishment of an Independent Technical Review Board, client notification standards, and a 7-year documentation retention period. This revision must be completed and implemented within 90 days of the effective date (January 15, 2026) to ensure compliance.
